name: superintellectual
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
extremely well-educated and interested in studying and other activities that involve careful thinking and mental effort: He regarded the professor as an impractical, superintellectual type. The course is a magnet for super-intellectual people.
relating to the ability to think and understand things, especially very complicated ideas: I wanted to get away from the kind of superintellectual music I was writing. Computers should be able to help us solve super-intellectual problems. a superintellectual argument/response/interpretation
More examplesFewer examplesThe super-intellectual politician absolutely hated many aspects of the party.The school is trying to change its image from super intellectual to smart but fun.Super-intellectual computers will be able to understand speech and emotions like a human.
